messages.content: “I will work tirelessly with all our communities in West Bromwich West. I will be visible, accessible and will listen to your concerns. I will champion local priorities and fight for better services.”

keyPolicies.policyTitle: An NHS that works for the many
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will scrap prescription charges, scrap hospital car parking charges, train more doctors and ensure GPs get to spend more time with their patients. We will keep the NHS budget and stop the creeping sell-off of the service to corporations.
Labour will establish a National Education Service, recruit more teachers, build new schools and ensure more working class kids get the chance to go to university.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Ending Low Pay Britain and Scrapping Universal Credit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will establish a £10 an hour minimum wage for all workers and scrap Universal Credit. This will lift millions out of poverty.

issues.economy: Ending Low Pay Britain and Scrapping Universal Credit: Labour will establish a £10 an hour minimum wage for all workers and scrap Universal Credit. This will lift millions out of poverty.
issues.education: Reducing class sizes: Labour will establish a National Education Service, recruit more teachers, build new schools and ensure more working class kids get the chance to go to university.
issues.health: An NHS that works for the many: Labour will scrap prescription charges, scrap hospital car parking charges, train more doctors and ensure GPs get to spend more time with their patients. We will keep the NHS budget and stop the creeping sell-off of the service to corporations.
issues.socialWelfare: Ending Low Pay Britain and Scrapping Universal Credit: Labour will establish a £10 an hour minimum wage for all workers and scrap Universal Credit. This will lift millions out of poverty.

community.content: I will be visible, accessible and will listen to your concerns. I will champion local priorities and fight for better services.

leaflet.personalStatement: “I have spent most of my career working for the NHS, starting as a temp and working my way up. I saw the improvements under a Labour government and the people’s needs have been dramatically worse under the Tories. I’m standing as your Labour candidate for the West Bromwich West because [...] I will fight for the services you need and deserve.”

endorsements.endorser: Ahmadul Haque, MBE, former Lord Mayor of Sandwell
endorsements.endorsement: “James will be an excellent MP for West Bromwich West. He is part of the new generation of politicians. He has a real passion for social justice and will be an asset for all of our communities in this constituency.”

endorsements.endorser: Dharminder Chuhan, Lecturer at Sandwell College and UCU branch chair
endorsements.endorsement: “Education belongs at the heart of our community. I am confident that when elected, James will fight for our community and our children’s futures. Educational opportunity will be available for all under this candidate.”

examples: Labour will scrap prescription charges, scrap hospital car parking charges, train more doctors and ensure GPs get to spend more time with their patients.
Labour will establish a National Education Service, recruit more teachers, build new schools and ensure more working class kids get the chance to go to university.
Labour will establish a £10 an hour minimum wage for all workers and scrap Universal Credit. This will lift millions out of poverty.
